newsitem.title: HONG KONG: MANILA CONSIDERS END TO CAPITAL ACCOUNT CURBS.
newsitem.headline: MANILA CONSIDERS END TO CAPITAL ACCOUNT CURBS.

text.p: The Philippine central bank is considering ending all restrictions on capital account, its governor Gabriel C. Singson said in Hong Kong on Friday.

"We are studying with the view to relaxing and probably dismantling all remaining restrictions on capital account," Singson said at a conference hosted by the International International Fund and Hong Kong Monetary Authority.
He later elaborated to Reuters on the sidelines of the conference on some of the remaining curbs which might be ended.

"We are reviewing...removing all the remaining restrictions on the capital account like for instance the need for prior approval of foreign borrowings by the private sector, and prior restriction of foreign investment," Singson said.
